tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE machinery_sensor_data (
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  machine_id INT NOT NULL,
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
  sensor_value FLOAT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  CONSTRAINT fk_machine FOREIGN KEY (machine_id) REFERENCES machines(machine_id)
);

CREATE TABLE machinery_sensors (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_name VARCHAR(50),
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
    location VARCHAR(50),
    last_reading_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    schedule_date DATE,
    maintenance_type VARCHAR(50),
    maintenance_status VARCHAR(20)
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES machinery_sensors(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE machinery_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    sensor_name VARCHAR(50),
    data_value FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE machinery_sensors (
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
  machine_id INT,
  location VARCHAR(100),
  reading DECIMAL,
  recorded_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE machine_details (
  machine_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  machine_name VARCHAR(100),
  manufacturer VARCHAR(100),
  install_date DATE,
  last_maintenance DATE
)

CREATE TABLE maintenance_schedule (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  machine_id INT,
  maintenance_type VARCHAR(50),
  scheduled_date DATE,
  technician VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE maintenance_history (
  maintenance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  machine_id INT,
  maintenance_type VARCHAR(50),
  completed_date DATE,
  technician VARCHAR(100),
  notes TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE machinery_sensor_data (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_type VARCHAR,
    sensor_value FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    location VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE machinery_details (
    machine_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    machine_name VARCHAR,
    manufacturer VARCHAR,
    year_of_production INT,
    maintenance_schedule VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    machine_id INT,
    log_type VARCHAR,
    log_description TEXT,
    log_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE machinery_failure_logs (
    failure_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    machine_id INT,
    failure_type VARCHAR,
    failure_description TEXT,
    failure_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE maintenance_schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    machine_id INT,
    next_maintenance_date DATE,
    maintenance_type VARCHAR,
    parts_replace BOOLEAN
);
